definition: variant of 閹|阉[yan1]/to castrate/variant of 淹[yan1]/to delay
variant of 閹|阉[yan1]/to castrate/variant of 淹[yan1]/to delay
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: The government should allow orderly dissolution for dying businesses.
sentences.chinese: 政府應該允許奄奄一息的企業有序地解體。

sentences.english: Chicken rice seed into unconsciousness, at the last gasp.
sentences.chinese: 雞飯仔人事不省，奄奄一息。

sentences.english: The dying soldier was groaning with pain.
sentences.chinese: 那個奄奄一息的士兵痛得直哼哼。

sentences.english: After the mother walks, rescues juicy awakes the phoenix bright not to have, oneself actually suffocate.
sentences.chinese: 母親走後，水靈救醒鳳熙無，自己卻奄奄一息。

sentences.english: I took the shirt and hurried to the side of the dying Mute Singer.
sentences.chinese: 我拿起法衣，飛奔到奄奄一息的“沉默的歌手”身旁。

sentences.english: A grey girl on a dying horse.
sentences.chinese: 一個灰衣女孩，騎着奄奄一息的馬。

sentences.english: Lothar Schramm is dying, face down in a pool of blood.
sentences.chinese: 洛薩施拉姆是奄奄一息，面對一灘血了。

sentences.english: The woman sat beside her dying father's bed to the bitter end.
sentences.chinese: 這女人一直堅強地陪伴奄奄一息的老父直到他去世。

sentences.english: Your cat is virtually dead, " he said. " Kidney failure. Organs atrophied .
sentences.chinese: 你們的貓奄奄一息了，“他說，”腎衰竭，器官萎縮。

sentences.english: Becomes gradually thin, one day finally faints the roadside, suffocates.
sentences.chinese: 漸漸地變得骨瘦如柴，一天終於昏倒路旁，奄奄一息。

sentences.english: Matt Hasselbeck's career may be on its last legs.
sentences.chinese: 馬特哈塞爾貝克的職業生涯可能因此奄奄一息。

sentences.english: Another couple of twitches were detected in moribund housing markets.
sentences.chinese: 另一個讓人抽搐的消息來自奄奄一息的房市。

sentences.english: Bodies with the skins ripped off. The hearts torn from the cadavers .
sentences.chinese: 遇害者奄奄一息，屍體被剝掉皮膚，掏空心臟。

sentences.english: Responsibility to protect is not yet dead, but it is fragile.
sentences.chinese: “保護責任”概念並未死亡，但已奄奄一息。

sentences.english: He gave it to me while he lay dying.
sentences.chinese: 當他奄奄一息時，他將那給了我。

definition: to have only a breath of life (idiom)
nearing death/on the point of demise/approaching extinction
covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
to stop breathing/to breathe one's last/to die/to cut the gas supply
to be all skin and bones (idiom)/also written 皮包骨[pi2 bao1 gu3]
to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
